news.headline: Why Altria Stock Lost 15% in October
news.summary: Shares of Altria (MO +0.10%) were heading lower last month as the Marlboro-maker disappointed investors with its third-quarter earnings report. A middling earnings report sent the stock lower. According to data from S&P Global Market Intelligence, the stock fell
news.article_text:
A middling earnings report sent the stock lower.

Shares of Altria (MO +0.10%) were heading lower last month as the Marlboro-maker disappointed investors with its third-quarter earnings report.

Heading into the report at the end of the month, the stock was slumping, though there wasn't much news out on the stock. That may be a sign that investors thought the stock was overbought after it had soared earlier in the year.

According to data from S&P Global Market Intelligence, the stock fell 15%.

news.headline: Last month marked worst October for layoffs in more than 20 years: Challenger
news.summary: Last month’s total of 153,074 announced job cuts was the highest for a single month in 20 years. The total for the year-to-date total is at its lowest level since 2011.
news.article_text:
Last month was the worst October for layoff announcements since 2003 as companies slashed roles to save money, pared back pandemic-era hires, and planned ahead for artificial intelligence, according to the global outplacement firm Challenger, Gray & Christmas.

You could pick up shares today and pay less than Buffett did! The big question is, should you?

news.headline: SpaceX Buys More EchoStar Spectrum to Boost Mobile Ambitions
news.summary: SpaceX agreed to buy an additional $2.6 billion in spectrum licenses from EchoStar, building on the $17 billion worth of licenses that it agreed to buy earlier this year.  The spectrum purchases give Elon Musk’s rocket and satellite-internet company an expanded foothold in the mobile-phone business and will give EchoStar a SpaceX stake that tops $11 billion at the rocket company's current share price.  SpaceX provides home broadband service through its Starlink business and has dipped into the mobile-phone sector through a U.S. partnership with T-Mobile.

news.article_text:
A middling earnings report sent the stock lower.

Shares of Altria (MO +0.10%) were heading lower last month as the Marlboro-maker disappointed investors with its third-quarter earnings report.

news.summary: Last year, Meta projected that 10% of its overall annual revenue — $16 billion — would come from fraudulent advertisements on its apps. For three years, Meta failed to protect its users from ads promoting illegal gambling, investment schemes, and banned medical products.

Last year, Meta projected that 10% of its overall annual revenue — $16 billion — would come from fraudulent advertisements on its apps, according to a report from Reuters.

The documents accessed by Reuters also show that for three years, Meta failed to protect its users from ads promoting illegal gambling, investment schemes, and banned medical products. These fraudulent ads purport to offer a product or service that isn’t real and may be intended to solicit payments from less savvy users.

news.headline: SpaceX Buys More EchoStar Spectrum to Boost Mobile Ambitions
news.summary: SpaceX agreed to buy an additional $2.6 billion in spectrum licenses from EchoStar, building on the $17 billion worth of licenses that it agreed to buy earlier this year.  The spectrum purchases give Elon Musk’s rocket and satellite-internet company an expanded foothold in the mobile-phone business and will give EchoStar a SpaceX stake that tops $11 billion at the rocket company's current share price.  SpaceX provides home broadband service through its Starlink business and has dipped into the mobile-phone sector through a U.S. partnership with T-Mobile.
